title: Jobs API / Subcontractor Portal
technologiesUsed: ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Web Api, .NET Core, EF Core, Angular 2+, AngularJs, Azure DevOps
description: My job in this company involves continous development in a number of in-house applications that are assigned to my team. The two that I choose to name here are Jobs API, and Subcontractor Portal. This company keeps tracks of millions of facilities maintenance jobs performed by subcontractors, across 3 countries. The subcontractor portal (which integrates with Jobs API) allows the subcontractors to close down jobs, submit invoices, upgrades, and browse documents. The subcontractor portal uses a dual authorization system with ADFS-based SSO (for internal users), and OpenID Connect (for external users). The Jobs API uses OAuth authentication.
jobResponsibilities: Integration between one application with another

title: Intelligent Tourism
technologiesUsed: ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Web Api 2, WCF, AngularJs, Bootstrap
description: I listed Intelligent Tourism here because it was by far the most ambitious project that I have ever been involved in. iTourism was not an application, but an ecosystem. Containing an eCommerce site (the B2C), an admin site (the B2B), a point-of-sale (POS) system, and a Web Api as a central system, that can also be consumed by third-party B2C partner sites. My primary development contribution was in the Web Api side of things, but I was also placed as an informal lead of the B2C team. The project was ultimately a failure as it did not come to fruition, and the company eventually closed down.
jobResponsibilities: Acted as Software Developer for the project, and as a Team Lead to one of the projectâ€™s teams. Leads and manages a team of up to 4 team members during project, covering Web Designers, QA Engineers and Software Engineers.
Once in every 2 weeks, conducts iteration planning and retrospective
Appointed as Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for third party B2C integration partner
Prepares and provides API releases documentation to partners.

title: Submission Tracking and Rating System
technologiesUsed: ASP.NET MVC, WPF, AngularJs, Bootstrap, SQL Server Reporting Services
description: STARS was a memorable project for me as it was fun to develop for. Through this project I get to see the amount of efficiency that can be gained from a good software solution. Our client was an organization that enforces all banks in Malaysia to submit a set of documents each year, the submitted documents (which are normally in the form of large Excel files) are normally given to the client's staff by a hard disk, and then manually processed to output a "Rating" that determines a bank's premium. This process takes them many weeks to complete, which through our software was largely reduced.
jobResponsibilities: Met the users to study requirements.
Co-authored the User Requirement Specification (URS) Document with a senior.

title: Capital Gains Tax Worksheets
technologiesUsed: ASP.NET Web Forms, ADO.NET, MySQL, jQuery, Telerik RadControls
description: Capital Gains Tax Worksheets (or CGTW) was my earliest experience working with a large team, and my first experience working with SCRUM. Throughout the project, there was an average of 5 developers and 2 testers within the development team. The application's core purpose is processing historical stocks data with the intent of calculating and predicting capital gains tax.  Architecturally, it was a ASP.NET Web Forms project with ADO.NET data access layer. This project had a heavy reliance on Stored Procedures.
